articles.description: Follow live commentary, score & text updates as Man City face Liverpool plus six other fixtures in the Premier League, including Brentford v Arsenal.
articles.title: Premier League: Man City host Liverpool in first of seven matches - Haaland starts

articles.description: Two draws in a row gives hope to title challengers, says Phil McNulty, but those results might be the best their rivals can hope for.
articles.title: 'Title race may not be formality most are expecting'

articles.description: Second-half goals from Jamaal Lascelles, Joelinton and Anthony Gordon prove the difference as Newcastle emphatically return to winning ways against Chelsea.
articles.title: Newcastle too strong for 10-man Chelsea

articles.description: Jannik Sinner beats Novak Djokovic to help Italy overcome Serbia to join Australia in the Davis Cup final.
articles.title: Sinner stuns Djokovic as Italy reach Davis Cup final

articles.description: Barcelona require a late own goal to salvage a point at mid-table Rayo Vallecano in La Liga.
articles.title: Barcelona need own goal to salvage draw at Rayo

articles.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen beats Ferrari's Charles Leclerc to take his 12th pole in 22 races this year at the season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.
articles.title: Verstappen on Abu Dhabi pole as Hamilton struggles

articles.description: Substitute Joao Pedro scores twice as 10-man Brighton condemn Nottingham Forest to a first home defeat of the season in a fiery five-goal thriller.
articles.title: Pedro double seals dramatic Brighton win at Forest

articles.description: Jevon Holland's sensational interception touchdown helps the Miami Dolphins to a 34-13 victory at the New York Jets.
articles.title: Holland scores 99-yard touchdown in Dolphins win

articles.description: Follow live text updates, Final Score & Squad Goals as leaders Leicester host Watford as one of 11 Championship games.
articles.title: Championship: 10 games at 15:00 including Leicester v Watford

articles.description: Jon Obika's dramatic 90th-minute equaliser ensures Scottish Premiership leaders Celtic fail to stretch their advantage to an 11-point margin in a chaotic draw with Motherwell.
articles.title: Obika earns Motherwell dramatic point at Celtic
